name: Glint2
tagline: Regridding Library for GCM / Ice Model Coupling
body:
### Introduction

GLINT2 is a library intended for the coupling of climate models (GCMs) and ice models.  It was developed by [Robert Fischer](http://www.giss.nasa.gov/staff/rfischer/) (@citibob) at NASA GISS in New York City, and is licensed via the GPL v3.  GLINT2 is written in C++, and is intended for use with GCMs and climate models written in C/C++ and Fortran 2003.

GLINT2 implements the transformations described in the paper _A System of Conservative Regridding for Ice / Atmosphere Coupling in a GCM_ (not yet published).

GLINT2 code may be downloaded at this GitHub repository.  GLINT2 documentation is found at [this project's Wiki](https://github.com/citibob/glint2/wiki).

If you are interested in using GLINT2 or joining as a committer, please email Robert Fischer <robert.fischer@nasa.gov>
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
